title: Scientists say bad memories could be rewritten while you sleep
description: A recent study reveals that positive memories, especially during sleep, can weaken the impact of negative ones. Researchers found that by re-associating neutral cues with pleasant images, participants later recalled negative associations less vividly. This gentle crowding out, particularly during sleep's memory processing phase, offers a promising, non-invasive avenue for managing distressing recollections.

Digital resources on stress management are also available online, promoting emotional well-being for confident exam approaches.

description: Mamata Banerjee also accused the EC of adopting what she described as "wrong, unconstitutional and undemocratic" methods in carrying out the revision exercise ahead of assembly elections. The TMC supremo’s fresh set of allegations against the poll panel was made on a day when her party MP Derek O’Brien moved the Supreme Court against the EC, claiming it has taken recourse to “arbitrary and procedurally irregular actions” for conducting the ongoing SIR in West Bengal.

India issues travel advisory for Venezuela; shares emergency helpline details
description: India has issued a travel advisory urging citizens to avoid non-essential travel to Venezuela due to escalating tensions and volatility. This follows similar high-level warnings from the US, Canada, and Australia, highlighting significant security and humanitarian concerns, including crime, political instability, and shortages of essential goods.

title: 'One step ahead': Yuvraj explains why Gill is more consistent than Abhishek Sharma
description: Yuvraj Singh reveals the distinct paths of Shubman Gill and Abhishek Sharma, nurtured under his guidance. Gill's exceptional dedication and adaptability propelled his rapid ascent, while Sharma's rise followed a structured four-year plan focused on national selection. Yuvraj highlights their contrasting styles: Sharma's fearless T20 aggression versus Gill's patient, consistent approach, creating a potent duo for Indian cricket.

title: 'People died in front of me': Indian recalls Bondi beach attack; was meters away from gunmen
description: An Uber driver, Rahemath Pasha, recounted his harrowing experience during the Bondi Beach mass shooting on December 14. Despite his fear, he chose to help an elderly woman and others, demonstrating profound humanity amidst the violence. His actions highlight courage and compassion in the face of tragedy.

Vijay's 'Jana Nayagan' censor row: Madras HC questions release date; postpones hearing
description: Thalapathy Vijay's film 'Jana Nayagan' faces a censor row. The Madras High Court questioned the January 9 release date. The court postponed the hearing to January 7. Producers stated the film is eligible for a U/A certificate. The delay is administrative. The court directed a formal complaint filing regarding religious sentiments. The film's release remains uncertain.

description: From a winding journey that began in Sialkot to creating history in the SA20, Sikandar Raza’s career is a testament to resilience and reinvention. Overcoming personal tragedy, health scares and early international struggles, the Zimbabwe all-rounder has emerged as a global T20 freelancer, hoping his trailblazing path inspires the next generation of cricketers back home.

Carse promptly complied, moving them to the back of his head. Meanwhile, Smith achieved a significant milestone, becoming the second-highest run-scorer in Ashes history, surpassing Jack Hobbs.

On this day: Chappell, Lillee & Rod Marsh retired together at SCG
description: On January 6, 1984, Australian cricket legends Greg Chappell, Dennis Lillee, and Rod Marsh played their final Test together at the SCG. Chappell retired as Australia's highest run-scorer, Lillee as the world's leading wicket-taker, and Marsh with a then-world record for dismissals. Their simultaneous farewell marked the end of a golden era.

description: Indian investors navigated a turbulent 2025, with gold outperforming equities and SIP inflows soaring. As macro signals shift towards growth, 2026 demands disciplined processes over prediction. The focus is on formalizing asset allocation, scaling contributions, and protecting against behavioral mistakes to anchor wealth.

'Will Trump kidnap PM?' Chavan's bizarre remark amid Venezuela crisis; BJP hits back
description: Former Maharashtra CM Prithviraj Chavan linked US trade tensions and tariffs on India to the alleged CIA-led operation in Venezuela, questioning if President Trump would kidnap India's Prime Minister. He criticised the government's silence on Venezuela and its perceived fear of the US, highlighting India's need to find alternative export markets due to the 50% US tariff.

description: The order was passed on a group of petitions alleging that Supreme Court norms governing sports body elections were violated and that favouritism was shown while adding names to the voters’ list released on December 25, 2025. The petitioners, including former India cricketer Kedar Jadhav, claimed that several of the newly inducted members had no link with cricket.

Snow, Kangris and Pherans: How Kashmir adapts to the rhythm of Chillai Kalan — inside the 40-day spell
description: Kashmir's harshest winter period, Chillai Kalan, has arrived, transforming the valley into a snow-draped spectacle. This year, the region is experiencing a remarkable surge in tourism, with hotels fully booked and events planned across popular destinations. The season also brings vital snowfall for agriculture and refuge for migratory birds, while the Army maintains a proactive counter-terror posture.

'Failing to do its duty': SC raps pollution body over Delhi air; orders to submit expert report
description: The Supreme Court has criticized the Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) for its inaction on Delhi's worsening air quality, which remains in the 'poor' category. The court has directed the CAQM to convene an expert meeting within two weeks to identify pollution causes and long-term solutions, rejecting a request for a two-month adjournment on key measures.

KEAM 2026 registration begins at cee.kerala.gov.in; exam dates out
Civic wars 2026: Thackerays reunite, alliances shift — Maharashtra's BMC power game explained
description: Maharashtra gears up for crucial local body elections on January 15, marking the first electoral test of 2026. These polls, delayed by legal battles, will see alliances like the Mahayuti and Maha Vikas Aghadi vying for control of key urban centers, including the financially significant Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation.

title: SC: Fearless judges bedrock of judiciary, can’t be penalised for error of judgment
description: The Supreme Court ruled that judges cannot face disciplinary action for errors in judgment, emphasizing that a fearless judiciary is crucial for the rule of law. The court expressed concern over frivolous complaints against judges, which can lead to trial court judges hesitating to grant bail, and reinstated a judge terminated for an error in judgment.

title: Delhi riots case: SC placed Khalid, Sharjeel on 'different footing'; what chargesheet said
description: The Supreme Court placed Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam on a ‘different footing' from others while denying bail, citing Delhi Police's evidence.  In their chargesheet, police accused Khalid as the central figure and Imam as his protégé, presenting phone calls, speech clips, and witness statements as proof of their alleged coordination of violence.

title: Uttarakhand: Govt mulls banning non-Hindus’ entry in 105 ghats of Haridwar; 1916 agreement in focus
description: Uttarakhand government is considering a ban on non-Hindus entering Haridwar's 105 ghats, potentially restoring a 1916 agreement. The state also plans to declare Haridwar and Rishikesh as 'holy cities'. This move follows demands from some religious leaders, though opposition exists among residents and former Ganga Sabha officials.

title: OpenAI IPO plans: Altman says no interest in public firms CEO role; timeline uncertain
description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has expressed zero enthusiasm for leading a public company, despite acknowledging an IPO is likely necessary for capital and growth.  While he finds public market participation in value creation appealing, he anticipates the process will be 'annoying.'  The AI giant, valued at potentially $1 trillion, is reportedly preparing for a 2026 or 2027 listing.

title: Taylor Swift reportedly shaken by Travis Kelce’s controversial confession
description: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce have been dealing with a lot on their plate ever since they announced their engagement last year. While the two have kept themselves busy with planning their wedding, it seems Taylor Swift is deeply unsettled by some of Travis Kelce's words that he has said in public about his past. It seems this has become a huge deal for Taylor Swift ahead of their wedding.

title: Math genius Joel David Hamkins says AI models are basically useless for math tasks
description: Renowned mathematician Joel David Hamkins has voiced strong doubts about large language models' utility in mathematical research, calling their outputs "garbage" and "not mathematically correct." He highlights AI's frustrating tendency to confidently assert incorrectness and resist correction, mirroring unproductive human interactions. Despite AI's benchmark successes, Hamkins finds current systems unreliable for genuine research collaboration.
